subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Blake Mycoskie: TOMS and the One-for-One Model
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Blake Mycoskie: TOMS and the One-for-One Model.

hook.text: Blake Mycoskie saw children in Argentina without shoes. He started TOMS: buy a pair, give a pair.

buildup.text: The one-for-one model turned a purchase into a social act. Customers felt good buying shoes.

discovery.text: TOMS sold over 100 million pairs and inspired dozens of 'buy one, give one' companies.

twist.text: Critics argued free shoes hurt local shoemakers. Mycoskie later shifted to supporting local economies instead.

climax.text: TOMS evolvedâ€”proving social enterprises must measure impact, not just intention.

punchline.text: Good intentions need good data to become good outcomes.

quiz.question: What criticism did TOMS's one-for-one model face?
options: Free shoes could undermine local shoemakers and economies in recipient countries
The shoes were poor quality and fell apart quickly
The model was too expensive to sustain profitably
